body: Let me know if I need to work on a reproducer for this, from my POV it looks like an issue that can be assessed with statically checking the code.

issue.title: SurefireLoader discovers JUnit 5 TestEngine service resources in unstable order
issue.body:
While investigating https://github.com/eclipse-jdt/eclipse.jdt.ui/issues/2423, I found weird behavior in `tycho` and in JUnit 5.

For the latter I opened a discussion: https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/discussions/4855

I'm still debugging the why, but I've had two different `mvn verify` sessions for JDT UI tests, in which `org.eclipse.tycho.surefire.osgibooter.SurefireLoader.findResources(String)` will find bundle resources in different order. I.e. when JUnit 5 is looking for `org.junit.platform.engine.TestEngine`, `org.eclipse.tycho.surefire.osgibooter.SurefireLoader` will provide those services in instable order. This then leads to instable test order, which then leads to issues like https://github.com/eclipse-jdt/eclipse.jdt.ui/issues/2423.

In essence a committer added a test which didn't properly clean up, CI tests were green, after merging CI tests became flaky. A while after (after someone found time to open an issue for the flaky tests, after someone else found time to look into the flaky tests), we discovered the problematic tests. This was not simple, since test order was not stable.

So we should look into why `SurefireLoader` is not loading the JUnit 5 services in a stable order.

issue.title: Github CI builds are "broken"
issue.body:
Originally observed in BETA_JAVA25, but at a closer look recent CI builds triggered from github (PR builds and master builds) constantly show 21+ failures, none of which I can reproduce locally. Also Y-builds and I-builds are clean.

For a recent example see https://ci.eclipse.org/jdt/job/eclipse.jdt.ui-github/job/master/470/testReport/

rename.from: LauncherDiscoveryResult.retainEngines puts a LinkedHashMap content into a HashMap

issue.title: Retain original `TestEngine` order after pruning

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
Prior to this commit, `LauncherDiscoveryResult.retainEngines()` stored the pruned `LinkedHashMap` content in a `HashMap`, which sometimes resulted in different iteration order for pruned test engines.

To address that, this commit replaces the use of `Collectors.toMap(Function<? super T, ? extends K>, Function<? super T, ? extends U>)` -- which creates a `HashMap` -- with the use of `Collectors.toMap(Function<? super T, ? extends K>, Function<? super T, ? extends U>, BinaryOperator<U>, Supplier<M>)` -- which allows us to specify that the pruned test engines should be stored in a `LinkedHashMap` to retain the original iteration order.

Fixes #4862

body:
Thanks for raising the issue and for providing the detailed analysis.

I've submitted PR #4864 to address this.

rename.to: `LauncherDiscoveryResult` loses original `TestEngine` registration order if engines are pruned

body:
> Thanks for raising the issue and for providing the detailed analysis.
> 
> I've submitted PR [#4864](https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/pull/4864) to address this.

Thank you for fixing this!

> Thank you for fixing this!

You're welcome!

We are considering backporting this to `5.13.x` as well.

> We are considering backporting this to `5.13.x` as well.

Any idea of a possible timeline for this?

> Any idea of a possible timeline for this?

We are currently focusing our efforts on JUnit 6.0 GA, which is tentatively scheduled for release on September 19, 2025.

Thus, I assume we will backport this fix to `5.13.x` and release `5.13.5` around the same time as 6.0 GA.

I'll coordinate that with @marcphilipp once he is back "in the office".
